bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Felix E. Fernandez, August 14, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests the address of John R. Taylor, a clerk at Las Animas Hospital in 1901.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Felix E. Fernandez, August 14, 1940
div1.opener:
August 14, 1940
Dr. Felix Fernandez
Las Animas Hospital
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Fernandez:
div1.p:
Last April, when I was doing some medical historical researches
on the conquest of yellow fever, I had the pleasure of being introduced to
you by Dr. Juan Castro. You thought that I might be able to get in touch
with Mr. John R. Taylor, who was a clerk in Las Animas Hospital in 1901, and
who submitted to the experiments of Dr. Guiteras. I believe you told me he
now lives in Philadelphia, and that you had his address. I would appreciate
it greatly if you would give me this address.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
